evs.metric.metrics
Class ROCScore

java.lang.Object
  evs.metric.metrics.Metric
      evs.metric.metrics.ScoreMetric
          evs.metric.metrics.ROCScore
All Implemented Interfaces:
BootstrapableMetric, CategoricalMetric, EnsembleMetric, SingleValuedMetric, SkillScore, ThresholdMetric, java.lang.Comparable
public class ROCScore
extends ScoreMetric
implements EnsembleMetric, SingleValuedMetric, ThresholdMetric, SkillScore, CategoricalMetric, BootstrapableMetric

The ROC score comprises the rescaled area under the ROC curve (AUC), which provides a measure of a probability forecasts ability to discriminate between events and non-events according to the observed outcome at different forecast probability levels. For the sample climatology as the reference forecast, the rescaled quantity is 2*AUC-1. Multiple options exist for computing the empirical AUC, including the default: Mason, S.J. and N.E. Graham. (2002) Areas beneath the relative operating characteristics (ROC) and relative operating levels (ROL) curves: Statistical significance and interpretation, Q. J. R. Meteorol. Soc., 128, 2145-2166.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

ROCScore

public ROCScore(DoubleProcedureParameter event,
                ROCScorePointsParameter pointCount,
                ForecastTypeParameter fType,
                UnconditionalParameter unconditional,
                FittedAUCParameter fitted,
                ReferenceForecastParameter ref,
                ROCScoreMethodParameter method,
                MinimumSampleSizeParameter minS,
                BootstrapParameter bs)
Attempts to construct a ROC Score object with associated parameters.

Parameters:
event - the event
pointCount - the number of points to include in the diagram
fType - the forecast types
unconditional - is true to always use unconditional pairs, false to use conditional pairs when available
fitted - is true to fit a smooth bivariate model to the empirical AUC results
ref - the reference forecasts used in the skill calculation
method - the method used to compute the ROC Score
minS - the minimum sample size
bs - the bootstrap parameter

compute

public final MetricResult[] compute(int forecastType,
                                    PairedData paired,
                                    MetricResult refResult)
                             throws MetricCalculationException
Uses the specified paired data to compute and return the result of the metric. The metric results are returned, together with the sample counts, but not stored locally. The metric result is located in the first index of the return array and the sample counts are located in the second index. Optionally, specify the results of a reference forecast from which to compute skill if the metric is a skill score. If the forecastType is ForecastTypeParameter.REFERENCE_FORECAST, the ROC score is computed relative to sample climatology. Note, however, that the metrics associated with a verification unit may have a different forecast type in another context, which is why the forecast type is specified explicitly. The returned results comprise {Empirical ROC Score, Fitted ROC Score, Empirical ROC area, Fitted ROC area, Empirical ROC area for reference, Fitted ROC area for reference} or the null value where undefined.

Specified by:
compute in class Metric
Parameters:
forecastType - the forecast type
paired - the paired data
refResult - the results for a reference forecast (may be null)
Returns:
the metric result and sample counts
Throws:
MetricCalculationException

getAUC

public final MetricResult getAUC(DoubleMatrix2D data,
                                 DoubleProcedure pro,
                                 double nV)
                          throws MetricCalculationException
Returns the ROC area from the input data. The input should comprise one column of observations (at index 0) and the remaining n columns should comprise the n ensemble members (index 1 through n).

Parameters:
data - the input data
pro - the threshold with values in real units
nV - the null value
Returns:
the ROC area
Throws:
MetricCalculationException
